boardgame.name: C.L.O.W.N
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D.s is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full time job to try and keep track of them as well as update information about the, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This is a series of small products that will introduce new villains and heroes for you campaign.

This installment will introduce a reintroduce the ever favorite C.L.O.W.N. Those fun loving law enforcement infuriating band of misfits. They’re out to rob, plunder and pull practical jokes across the globe.

boardgame.name: Lyzif's Day
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seeking adventure has been more difficult than the quartet anticipated but they have reached the settlement of Statfhord. With a little luck, they might be able to find something to prove their heroism...after getting a drink at the tavern! Unbeknownst to them, the area is preparing to celebrate a religious holiday.

The scenario was designed for a quartet of first level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Love & Justice Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Love is a powerful emotion. And when you add in aliens, robots, radiation, magic, mutants, mad science, forgotten gods, and ancient curses, it becomes a SUPERpowerful force. Super-powered love leads to comedy, intrigue, risk-taking, sacrifice, and adventure! And Love & Justice is your guidebook to romance, love, and sex in superhero roleplaying games.

Illustrated throughout by Super Powered Legends artist Jacob Blackmon and published under the OGL and Super-Powered By M&M licenses, Love & Justice Volume 2 includes:

Rules to deal with Romance and Seduction
4 new Heroic Archetypes: Alien Heir, Magical Youth, Robotic Companion, Romance Deity
4 new Villainous Archetypes: Cosmic Consort, Evil Enchanter, Femme Fatale, Redeemable Villain
A handy-dandy Romantic Sub-Plot Generator


Together with its companion volume, Love & Justice Volume 2 gives you what you need to introduce romance to your superhero game without losing the heroics.

boardgame.name: Warado no bouken kakuchou #1 (Sorezore no Monogatari)
ワラドの冒険 拡張＃1 (それぞれの物語) (Adventure Of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story))
boardgame.description:
ワラドの冒険 拡張＃1 (それぞれの物語) Warado no bouken kakuchou #1 (Sorezore no Monogatari) - Adventure Of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story) is a small expansion deck for the base game Adventure of Warado. The expansion is only for 4 or 5 players. It is not designed for 2 or 3 players.

The deck of 16 events cards is split into two types of 8 cards each, for the first and second part of the game respectively. Each set of 8 cards is shuffled and 4 are dealt face down in a row along the top of the normal adventure section.

As players advance their cubes through the adventures, past the normal first column, the event cards are then triggered. The events for adventures 2-5 need four cubes to be advance, the latter events for adventures 6-9 need only three cubes to be advanced.

Some of the events are immediate, and some will affect scoring at the end of the game. Usually, one player will benefit by an event whilst the rest suffer.
user summary

boardgame.name: Warado no bouken kakuchou # 2 (Mahou-jin to touhou no Seirei)
ワラドの冒険 拡張 ＃2 (魔法陣と東方の精霊) (Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East))
boardgame.description:
ワラドの冒険 拡張 ＃2 (魔法陣と東方の精霊) Warado no bouken kakuchou # 2 (Mahou-jin to touhou no Seirei) - Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East) is a free to print'n'play expansion to Adventure of Warado. The expansion is for 5 players only, and is printed on A4 sheets.

This expansion offers 7 new cards to add to the base game, 5 magicians to aid your quest, and 2 Spirits, special magical creatures.
user summary

boardgame.name: Jinxed: A Vexing New Option For 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Brand New Variant Rule and Creatures For 5th Edition

“Superstitious? Of course, I’m superstitious, my friend. You’d be a fool to get on the bad side of the fey.”
- Allendon Mayersiel, ranger of Gillshire

A fey cackles mischievously as it flees into the dark treeline. A young dungeoneer’s stomach drops as she notices the glyphs under her feet. A group of travelers ignores the warnings from the town elder and drinks deeply from the well in the clearing.

Breaking local taboos, angering creatures, or simply being in the wrong place at the wrong time can see an adventurer’s luck spoil. And although it may not warrant a trip to a renowned archbishop to lift their burden, no hero enjoys being the target of a jinx.

The following describes the new game option jinxes and how to implement them into your games. As with all new variant rules, discuss with your gaming group if this will be a welcome addition to the tone and play style of your table.

This supplement includes:

A variant ruleset for jinxes
10 different Jinxes
The cauldron demon - a small fiend that's the bane of any alchemist
The hedge wisp - a tiny fey that lives to cause bad luck for unfortunate mortals
2 rare harvestable items that these vexing creatures can provide

boardgame.name: Gumiho Playable Race
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this digital book, you will find the Gumiho playable race, including the lore surrounding them, their birth and evolution, and their obsession with knowledge. You will also find two subraces to integrate into your games based on the gumiho’s two key life cycles.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Stampadia
boardgame.description:
The reign of Stampadia had thousands of years of history of dangerous places and brave mercenaries before disappearing mysteriously from our globe. But Stampadia monks, generation after generation, managed to document relentlessly the story of every single adventurer, the map of every single dungeon, and the clue of every single mystery in a huge tome called Chronicles Of Stampadia.

We managed to find a damaged copy in an abandoned basement and it looks like that the book is imbued with some kind of magic: the reader can live every page of its story with just two dice, an eraser, and a small token!

We’re trying to recover, translate and digitalize a new page of this book every day on the project website!

Chronicles of Stampadia is a print-and-play adventure game inspired by classic roguelikes, board games, and gamebooks that has a little twist: the map, the enemies, the quests, the mysteries, and the traps are mixed and generated by a computer algorithm, as in a roguelike videogame. On the Chronicles of Stampadia homepage you will find a unique dungeon to download, print, and discover every day.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Crowded Kitchen: Salt & Pepper Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Salt & Pepper Expansion adds additional recipes, stars, and ingredients to the base game, Crowded Kitchen. These cards allow Crowded Kitchen to be played with up to 7 players, 2 more than the base game's player count of 2-5.

The rules and gameplay for the Salt & Pepper Expansion are the same as those for Crowded Kitchen when playing with 4 or 5 players.

boardgame.name: Solaris: A Space Colonization Board Game
boardgame.description:
Solaris is a civi/euro game, with a sci-fi theme and medium interaction in which conflicts occur indirectly between players - disputes over actions, locations and resources.

In Solaris, each player represents a faction of the same Federation, which has been given a mission to explore the universe to discover new habitable planets. Everyone cooperates for the good of the Federation, but the game is competitive. Resources are public, meaning if you produce, any player can use the resources at the table. The objective is to gain points with the Federation government being the faction with the best performance in 4 categories (technologies, production, colonization and influence).

The mechanic is card driven where players, instead of playing an action for themselves, play an action that can be done by everyone, at the cost of placing their emissaries on the card. Players reveal the cards simultaneously, so each turn the player chooses which one he wants to activate. If the card the player played is activated by another player, he earns Solaris credits. Credits can be used in a variety of ways, from buying resources to activating certain actions. At the end of the game they serve as a wild resource for scoring if not used. Solaris is a management game with a lot of planning.

Colonies are represented by dice and the die value indicates the level of development of the colony. The more developed it is, the more it will generate credits and also colonization points. Tech cards give you unique abilities and also tech points, while building buildings allows you to earn production points and, of course, generate resources. Finally, there are public goals that when achieved allow the player to gain more emissaries to use and give points of influence. At the end of the game, your score is the sum of your 2 lowest tracks, which forces players to invest in all tracks.

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter Massive Hunting
モンスターハンター マッシヴハンティン
boardgame.description: In Massive Hunting, players take on the role of hunters who have to defeat a variety of monsters with touch commands like “tap” (slash the monster) and “flick” (move around it in a circle).

boardgame.name: Pikmin CYOA Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Starting off in this universe means you gotta be a tiny person (2 centimeters/a size of a nickel), and being a tiny person means you gotta have tiny gear and tiny vehicles.

boardgame.name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Yudong, 1948
boardgame.description:
As an expansions, it was listed together with the Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Huaihai, 1948-1949 . It tells the battle between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party in the east of Henan Province in June 1948 before the outbreak of the Huaihai Campaign.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with Jinan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.

boardgame.name: Descent: Legends of the Dark – Alternate Art Weapon Cards
boardgame.description: 12 playable uniquely designed weapons cards also found in corresponding app. Available when pre-ordering Descent: Legends of the Dark from participating stores.

boardgame.name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Jinan, 1948
boardgame.description:
Listed together with the Huaihai Campaign, it tells about the campaign of Jinpu railway middle section in May 1948 and the Jinan Campaign in September 1948.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with the Eastern Henan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.

boardgame.name: Battle of the Sexes
boardgame.description:
Battle of the Sexes has 660 questions (220 cards) split between male and female cards. For every question your team answers correctly, a trophy is moved closer to your team's Winner's Circle. Earn three trophies to win.

Each team can use Challenge Tokens. These Tokens could either propel you to an easy victory, or send you backwards. If your team doesn't know the answer to question, but you think the other team doesn’t know the answer either, you can throw the question back at them by playing one of your challenge tokens. If they answer incorrectly, move the trophy towards your side of the board. If they answer correctly, move the trophy towards their side of the board. Each team only has 3 Challenge Tokens.

boardgame.name: DerrocAr: The Five Presidents Week
boardgame.description:
DerrocAr is a game published by Ion Game Design that focuses on a short period of history with political turmoil. Derrocar, designed by a native Argentinian Bruss Brussco, is a card game about the several weeks in which Argentina had five presidents.

Are you ready to take a role in some of the most peculiar weeks in political history? Be one of the provincial governors trying to reach the presidency of Argentina in the middle of the political and economic crisis of 2001.

In this 1-5 player board game you play as the Senators and Governors of the provinces, all seeking to outmaneuver the others and become the next President of the República Argentina. In a country tired of politicians, you need to prove that you are the least bad option, by making sure that the provinces of the other governors are full of conflicts. By making it look like your opponents cannot even manage their own provinces, they will be even less able to manage the country. The game
ends when a player is declared President

The rounds are divided into two phases:
First, you have to choose one of the options on the board (propose a Laws, Decrees, Debt Payment, Embezzlement Fund, etc) and then buy cards from the Market. At the next phase, you play a set of cards from your hand (Make Operations, Lobby, create conflict with the Establishment, create bad campaigns with the press, etc). Meanwhile, you handle your economy, the events (Lootings, Floods, a Bush's call, more) and negotiate short alliances.

To win, you must be the player with the most Support when the game ends because other players are full of conflicts.

The game comes with a modular system that allows the players to choose the complexity level that best suits their tastes.

boardgame.name: Chip 'n' Dale: Christmas Treasures
boardgame.description:
Chip ‘n’ Dale have found their way into the Christmas tree! Help them collect treasures and treats for their winter stockpile and avoid getting caught by Pluto!

On your turn, flip over cards to discover the hidden treasures and treats in the tree. Collect two cards and add them to your collection, but if Pluto caught you, you only take one! Grow your collection each turn and have the collection with the most points by end of the game to win!

boardgame.name: Disney Cookie Swap Card Game
boardgame.description:
The fast-paced cookie flipping and finding game! Join all your favorite Disney and Pixar friends for a holiday treat!

Players share and swap cookies from the sheet. When you collect four cards of the same character—DING! They’re done! Pour a glass of milk and enjoy this deliciously fun card game.

Player draws and trade cards on their turn until the deck runs on.

When deck is out, the player with most points (sets) wins.

boardgame.name: Jingle All the Way: It's Turbo Time!
boardgame.description:
Face off as frantic shoppers in the hunt for the most exclusive toy of the holiday season—Turbo Man! But there’s only one left, so be ready for mischief in this turbo-charged, trick-taking game! Based off the iconic ’90s movie, this game has you peeking, at, flipping, shuffling, and swapping tiles to get the best toys. Will you search for toys on the shelf or wait for another player to find the prize before snatching it from their cart? Fill your cart with the best toys to win!

Players take turns playing cards after the "trick rules" are shown. Whoever wins the trick gets to take a card from the pool or another player and hope it's Turbo Man.

Game ends after a number of rounds and whoever has Turbo Man in their area is the winner.

boardgame.description:

Take turns playing as the Whos or the Grinch. Draw cards and choose which Christmas goodies to keep. The Grinch steals cards away to improve his score, but each turn his heart grows! Collect sets and then score your cards to try to get the most points!

Play Pumpkin cards to throw Pumpkins at the other players, but watch out—they can play cards right back! Roll the special die to grab more Pumpkins, or dodge out of the way at the last second! boardgame.name: 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties – Seahorse Organizer
boardgame.description:
A 3D printed 1862 organizer for both tiles and tokens of the GMT printing. The token trays are designed for the RailsOnBoards Token upgrade set

The tiles are contained in 3 trays, each with magnets and metal embedded in them to help stacking and keep the trays together while moving the box. A lid is also included for containment of the top tiles.

The tokens and other pieces are split into two trays. Each tray also has magnets embedded in them and a lid to contain everything

The setup tray is designed to contain all that you need to setup the game. It contains the following
-40 x 12mm cylinders (20 colors) to mark the Home Station and to track the Revenue
-18 x 15mm discs (20 colors) to train permits (freight, local and express)
-8 x 10mm discs (2 colors) to indicate which companies were unavailable
-Train permit Tokens
-Starting Money and Cert Tokens
-Player order tokens
-15mm Phase tracker cylinder
-Elephant
-20x Company Director Shares

The token tray is designed to hold all the home station tokens on the sides for all 20 companies. Simply keep it by the board and pull the tokens required for each company when they are floated. It also has a spot in the top of the tray for the 10mm small station tokens.


Token/Setup Trays are not compatible with sleeved cards or the cardboard GMT Tokens***
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties

boardgame.name: The Nightmare Before Christmas: Making Christmas
boardgame.description:
Gather toys from Halloweentown for Jack Skellington to deliver on Christmas. But the presents are in pieces! Look for clever combos on the workbench that will help you put the toys together.

On your turn, swap two toy parts and use assembled toys to complete goal cards. Then refill the workbench, goal cards, and the toy-building continues to the next player! Hurry to put the toy parts together and be the player that completes the most goals to win!

Diablo II Resurrected features:

boardgame.name: Dr. Seuss Stack with the Cat Game
boardgame.description:
It’s a cold, cold, wet day and the Cat in the Hat has come to play! Stack the playthings one by one. But watch out—the Cat is up on a wobbly ball, so don’t let all the playthings fall!

Draw a card. Choose a plaything to stack on the Cat in the Hat. Be careful—don’t make the Cat drop it all!

Players pick from 2 available cards that have items on them to stack on the cat. Players are out when they make the stack topple. The last player in the game wins.

boardgame.name: Dr. Seuss Merry Grinchmas! Game
boardgame.description:
Every Who down in Who-ville likes Christmas a lot. But the Grinch, who lived just north of Who-ville, did NOT! While the Whos are busy dreaming of Christmas, the Grinch is slinking around Who-ville trying to stop Christmas from coming! Work together to collect presents to make the Whos’ holiday dreams come true before the Grinch steals them away. Collect more points than the Grinch by the time Whos start singing to win!

Player spins and moves on their turn. They draw cards and answer questions on them (very light kids game) about themselves, and get presents accordingly. Presents are worth certain points.

Game ends when the first person gets back to the Palace, and the person with the most points from their presents wins.

boardgame.name: BOLT RPG Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The BOLT RPG Engine is a flexible, action-centric "toolbox" RPG built on fast gameplay and escalating tension. The core d10+d4 resolution system returns fast and chaotic action, and the Tenacity mechanic encourages reckless play ideal for breathless gunfights and down-to-the-wire heists.

Every roll is interesting. Every encounter resolves quickly. Every failure is a dare to push your luck.

boardgame.name: 100 Book Titles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes your characters find themselves in a library, where scrolls and books fill the wall. Other times, they may open a dusty drawer in an empty castle and come across some forgotten reading material. Or they’re waiting for the town mayor to return to his office and they’re perusing his shelves.

In any case, here are 100 book titles they might see.

boardgame.name: 100 Non-currency Treasures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether it’s an inheritance, or winning something in a contest, or even finding something along side the roadway - sometimes a character or a party acquires treasure. If it’s always money, then that can get boring. Here’s a list of one hundred different items with which you can reward the players. Feel free to use d100 to choose randomly, or simply pick something from the list that would mess with them the most!

boardgame.name: Le Jeu du Doigt!
One Finger!
boardgame.description:
One Finger! is a mind game in which players try to anticipate the others' reaction to win as many cards as they can... with only one finger.

A quick glimpse of a game round
Everybody put their finger down on a card
Active player calls a number and everybody lift their finger... or don't
Count the fingers... same number the active player wins a card, otherwise they don't :)

Immediacy, guessing, bluffing, laughing... you just need One Finger to have fun!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Deities: Small Pantheon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you have a world where you want to keep things simple? Then this pantheon is for you! Only 4 gods & goddesses, and one major bad demon (who has 9 tagalong minions). All the races venerate a deity or one of their aspects. Or maybe the demon.

boardgame.name: Dr. Seuss Happy Birthday to You! Game
boardgame.description:
Today is your birthday, the Day of All Days, and it’s time to gather friends and family to celebrate with a game! Wake up to the Birthday Bird and travel with him to the wonderful places of Katroo.

Players spin to find out how many spaces they can move and collect colorful presents along the way like birthday cake, rockets, flowers, and more! Once the presents are all gone, it’s time to race back to the Birthday Palace for a celebration. Be the first one to arrive at the Palace and gain bonus stars!

players count up the start on their present cards and, if you have the most stars at the end of the game, you win!

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with a portrait. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This collection includes:


Auronial Strongspear - male half-elf fighter
Challa Stonehearth - female halfling barbarian
Druzen Wrensong - female gnome fighter
Jance Farwalker - female halfling fighter

boardgame.name: Metamorphosis (2020)
boardgame.description:
Play as Gregor, morphed into a tiny bug, and set out on an extraordinary journey to unravel the mystery of your transformation. Metamorphosis is a first person adventure set in a surrealist world where your newfound abilities are your last and only hope for redemption.

A story inspired by Kafka’s curious imagination
You wake up one morning to find that you are rather inconveniently transforming into a tiny bug, while your friend Joseph is being arrested for reasons unknown. Embark on a journey through a world which has become twisted and unfamiliar to save him and to find the answers you seek.

Search for redemption in hand-painted settings
What once seemed like mundane dwellings have become a vast obstacle course, and now you’ll have to chart your path through the dingy nooks and crannies that exist within the cracks of civilization. Use your wits to unravel the truth, and regain the life you once knew.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This collection includes:


The party is hired to guard an old soldier on his way back to a holy island
A priest wants the characters to investigate a masterwork recently donated to the town
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: La Carga de los 3 Reyes: Las Navas de Tolosa 1212
The Charge of the 3 Kings: Navas de Tolosa 1212
boardgame.description:
THE CHARGE OF THE 3 KINGS 1212: BATTLE OF LAS NAVAS DE TOLOSA

An epic clash between Christian and Muslim armies with a dynamic impulse-based game system that will delight even the most demanding strategists.

In 1212, Alfonso VIII decided that it was time to take revenge for his defeat at Alarcos a few years earlier at the hands of the Almohads. They had come to the Peninsula from the Maghreb imposing their rule and strict religious norms on the Andalusians with plans to expand Islam into the Christian-held territories. At that time, the Peninsula was divided into fie Christian kingdoms: Castile, Leon, Aragon, Portugal, and Navarre. However, being bound by the same religion did not stop them from fighting amongst themselves, and by no means where they unified nor did they have the same interests. Alfonso VIII of Castile requested the bull of the crusade for his fight against the Almohads, which meant that if he could not get the other Christian kingdoms to participate, he could at least make sure he would not be attacked from behind as he advanced south. The Pope grants this endeavor the status of a crusade, which results in knights and kings from other kingdoms and places in Europe joining Alfonso’s campaign, in addition to his neighbors on the Peninsula.

Each player has 5 formations and a deck of tactical cards and a deck of strategic cards. During his turn, the player will receive tactical and strategic cards and will activate 3 of his formations, each in a different impulse and alternating with his opponent. In each impulse you can play a tactical card, even in the opponent's impulse if the card is a reaction card. Additionally, during any moment of the turn, the player can play a strategic card.

Another strategic tool that each player has in his hand is the so-called "Command Point", which also has two aspects: the "Ordinary Command Point", to be used every turn by rolling the dice, and another of direct use, called "Single Command Point", of a single use in the whole game and that guarantees automatic success. With this command point you can alter or cancel different situations of the game, such as cards played by the opponent, anticipate the opponent by moving consecutive impulses, cancel the opponent's command points, avoid own defections, etc.

On each side there are units with heavy and light armor, both on horseback and on foot. The firing table discriminates the effectiveness according to the armor of the target, the weapon (crossbows, bows), the distance and whether the firing unit is mounted or not. Reaction shots are possible in the face of opponent's attacks.

Cavalry charges and possible reaction charges are also represented and we can find identified different types of units with specific rules, such as spearmen, black guards, religious fanatics, military orders, ultramontane crusaders, azgaz archers, etc.

The main characters of the battle are represented, such as the archbishop of Rada, the kings of Castile, Aragon and Navarre, the caliph and the Almohad vizier, etc., many of which have particularities that will have to be taken into account.

The terrain is practically flat except for the Cerro de los Olivos and the defensive palenque located at the top, which allows defensive advantages.

The game allows a high level of replayability thanks to the fact that the decks of cards and their distribution (with common cards and specific cards of each faction) achieve very diverse possible combinations. In addition, the historical deployment is facilitated, but with zones where the different formations are deployed freely by the player and in secret, so that within the delimited zones there is diversity of placement. Free placement is also allowed, which comes to permute the formations of place. Therefore, fun is assured.

In short, a historical war game, but that will not restrict players from making their own decisions. That is why The Charge of the 3 Kings, Las Navas de Tolosa 1212 is a highly recommended game for a wide range of public and, especially, for lovers of historical strategy.

Contents:

• 1 35.8” x 26” double sided game board
• 3 Sheets with 290 game counters
• 8 Dice (2 12-sided, 4 six-sided, and 2 eight-sid-ed)
• 1 Fog of War screen to hide starting deployment
• 78 cards (Tactics and Strategy)
• 1 Administrative Display
• 2 Ranged Attacks Tables/Player Aids
• 1 Summary sheet.
• 1 Rulebook English
• 1 Rulebook Spanish
• 1 Playbook English
• 1 Playbook Spanish

MAIN CHARACTERISTICS

• Recreate this epic battle in less than 3 hours.
• The game cards allow players to alter the game rules in order to surprise their opponent and foil their plans.
• Each side has at their disposal a wide variety of units with special abilities that affect the course of the battle, along with a unique deck of cards that will en-sure no two games are alike.
• Thanks to the game’s impulse-based system and the possibility to interrupt your opponent’s turn, both players will have a great time as the battle unfolds.
• The game’s design and illustration has been meticulously crafted with the idea of immersing players in a medieval-themed experience.
• Historical accuracy. Includes a scenario book that pro-vides a detailed summary of the battle, how it unfold-ed, the aftermath, as well as an example of play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spiral Dice Hackers' Guide
boardgame.description:
From Inside Book
So You Want to Hack with Spiral Dice
Maybe you’re working on the next great RPG system, or maybe you just want a tool to assist you when you get stuck as a GM. Whatever you’re thinking, you’ve arrived here because you want to use Spiral Dice for your own thing. That’s cool. The dice are designed to offer a lot of flexibility and numeric support for starting from just a few dice, and generating complex results that are simple to tally. They were created to support narrative complications alongside variable targets and degrees of success, but the “push-pull” inherent in their symbol pattern can be used for so much more than that.

This Guide is a means to provide you with math and inspiration so that you can go off and cook up wonderful things on your own. I hope that it gets you over the initial hurdle of understanding how the dice work. This Guide is not exhaustive (of course), because I don’t know what kinds of cool things people will do with these dice. It is here to get you off and running.

The tone of this Guide is academic but casual, and uses some terms related to probability distributions in the “Math” section. The subsequent sections focus more on practical use of the dice, and have less math.

boardgame.name: La Guerre à Outrance: Grand-Tactical Franco-Prussian Warfare in Miniature
boardgame.description:
La Guerre à Outrance is a traditional miniatures game for recreating the larger actions of the Franco-Prussian War in 1870. Players maneuver brigades -- whole armies can be fielded to re-play entire battles over the course of a normal gaming session. It is designed to be a fast-play alternative to other grand-tactical systems, and uses a common basing system for figures. Time, figure, and ground scales are higher, making for shorter, more decisive actions.

The emphasis is on army and corps-level command: the functions of lower-level generals and officers are handled by the system. This speeds play, and lets players focus on commanding armies instead of regiments or brigades. The game does not use dice, and allows one or more players to use a device to moderate play. The interface is simple and easy to use.

The system is built on a large body of research into the weapons, formations, and doctrine of the period, hiding this complexity to let players experience a more detailed level of simulation in a fast-play format. So go ahead and discover what it is like to fight war to the uttermost, in the most decisive European conflict of the later 19th century!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Kalia's Cleansing
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kalia's Cleansing is an erotic, pen & paper story game for one player.

All you need to play is a sheet of paper, pencil, one 6-sided die, this file and a B&W printer (you can also play while watching the file on screen). It's a small and quick game - single playthrough can take ~30 min.

In the game you become Kalia, a young huntress, cursed by a jealous witch. The curse forces any living creature nearby to try and mate with you. Hunted by everyone and everything, desperate for finding the cure, you stumble upon a legend of the Cleansing Spring, that has the power to remove curses. To find it, you'll have to venture into dangerous marshes, fight off lustful creatures, deal with strangers and explore ancient ruins to find the ancient path leading to the Spring.

Make haste, before your will wanes under the curse, leaving you a corrupted, mindless beast, roaming the marshes and copulating with anything that crosses your path.

boardgame.name: Dune: Imperium – Duncan, Loyal Blade
boardgame.description:
A promo card offered by Dire Wolf to customers who pre-ordered the Dune: Imperium - Deluxe Upgrade Pack.

Agent Ability: Recruit a troop.

Reveal ability: Gain one persuasion and two battle points.
When this card is trashed -> Deploy or retreat any number of your troops from or to your garrison.

boardgame.name: Dungeon 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a Dungeon themed map pack featuring a 44x32 crypt, a 34x22 Throne room, and a 34x22 Necromantic Forge. These maps were all multi page drawings which were then compiled down into three maps with various lighting schemes. It is intended for VTT but is scaled and drawn to be printable.

boardgame.name: Desert Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a desert themed map pack. It features Several wind blown roads, a canyon cross road, and an old temple. It is suitible for a variety of encounters and developed specifically for VTT. All maps are 3300x2550px, drawn for a 22x17 grid, and come with and without a grid as well as in a few lighting styles.

boardgame.name: Sci-fi Junkyard Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a sci-fi themed map pack featuring a junkyard. It features a bandit camp, several piles of ruined ships and debris and even a toxic swamp. It is suitible for a variety of encounters and developed specifically for VTT. All maps are 3300x2550px, drawn for a 22x17 grid, and come with and without a grid as well as in a few lighting styles.

boardgame.name: Cyber City 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a scifi themed map pack featuring a cityscape with tall buildings tight alleys and flashy colors. This is a quad map, 4 22x17 maps drawn and colored to be assembled into a larger 44x34 image. The pack contains 5 maps with various themes.

boardgame.name: Sacred Pool
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a Forrest themed map pack featuring an old sacred pool. This is a quad map, 4 22x17 maps drawn and colored to be assembled into a larger 44x34 image. The pack contains 5 maps with various themes.

boardgame.name: Temple 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a Temple themed map pack featuring: a crypt, an old temple basement, a hidden innersanctum and a ritual space. Each map is drawn to be 22x17 grid spaces and in tended for print or VTT use. They each have several lighting versions applied.

boardgame.name: Temple 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a Temple themed map. This map is 42x32 and drawn at 1/2 scale. It is a composite of 5 seperate maps with and without a grid and intended for print or VTT use.

boardgame.name: Cemetery 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a cemetary themed map. Four maps draw individually and combined together to make a larger map. This map is 42x32 and drawn at 1/2 scale. While this map is drawn for VTT it is also excelltent for printing. It comes in a variety of seasons and light styles.

boardgame.name: Adventure Sandbox 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventure Sandboxes are a location with a map. Suggested hooks could give characters a reason to visit. You'll also find information about NPCs, geographic features, and situations for your players to discover.

Please note: a Sandbox is NOT a complete adventure! It's a location with details for players to discover and interact with. Sandboxes are game sytem neutral, meaning you can use almost any system you like to run a game there.

This Sandbox covers Tinyhorn, a small hamlet of 24 people, living by a bridge over a small river. Characters can discover a witch, a bandit in hiding, a haunted barrow, and more.

boardgame.name: Magma Flow Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stream of magma flows through these interconnected underground caverns. Embers rise up past charred stone cliffs, while thin stone bridges cross high above. There are plenty of places for monsters to hide, or ambush from above.

boardgame.name: Rift to the Plane of Fire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lava bubbles over from the edges of this rift, lapping against the stairway leading down and causing the surrounding trees to burst into flame. The plane of fire is seeping into the material realm, growing larger by the minute.
Scorched rocks protrude from the sides of the rift, blackened by rising fumes from the magma below. Embers sparkle and dance as they escape, spreading and causing spot-fires in the surrounding areas.

Adventure Seed

While visiting a town celebrating one of it’s famous solstice festivals you feel the ground shake. A loud boom reverberates throughout the air and as you look over the surrounding market you see a pillar of lava and ash shoot above the treeline. ‘That looks like it’s in the direction of the portal!’ Says an old man beside you, dropping a melon in shock. He then hikes up his robe and runs toward the blast, sandals flapping against the cobblestones.

When you arrive at the portal you see a broken circle filling quickly with rising lava, charred stone outcrops jutting out of the earth with disturbed soil crumpling around their bases. The stones continue to grow slowly. Scattered throughout you spot scorched human limbs, as well as brass items. Flames rise from the magma, separating and roaming as various kinds of fire elementals. They set the trees and surrounding greenery ablaze wherever they touch.

‘Just as I feared,’ says the old man. ‘The portal was too old and has finally given way.’ Turning to you, he says ‘We need to close the rift. You look capable—help me get past the elementals and you’ll get any magic item you want. Just buy me time to shut down the magical stones holding the portal open.’
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The town—renowned throughout the kingdoms for its magical items—relies on this ancient portal. It can only be opened during the four seasonal solstices and during each of the seasons it points to a different plane of existence (earth, air, fire, water).

Every solstice a party of local adventurers would open the portal and bear gifts (today, brass) to the other side, braving the harsh realms and returning with resources. Those were then used by the artisans to craft the magic items. But ages of use had weakened the portal and today it finally reached breaking point.

When the adventurers activated it, the ring shattered, causing the portal to explode and kill them instantly. Now the plane of fire is pouring into the material realm through the growing rift and needs to be stopped. Instead of waiting for the elder to shut down the stones you could destroy them, which would be much faster—only, the portal will never open again...

boardgame.name: Rift to the Plane of Water
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An opened rift to the plane of water has brought a flood to the surrounding land, rising every minute. Coral and seaweed grow on the surrounding rocky outcrops; a sign of the plane of water warping the material realm.
Fish dart between rocks, while above the water-level a dying forest waits.

boardgame.name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield – Evolving Skies
boardgame.description:
Feel the power of the shifting winds, and brace for an epic storm as mighty Dragon-type Pokémon make their triumphant return! Rayquaza VMAX leads the surge from on high, and Duraludon VMAX towers above the land in its Gigantamax form, joined by Dragonite V, Noivern V, and more. As the clouds part, Eevee's Evolutions appear in a full rainbow of Pokémon V and Pokémon VMAX to signal a bright new day in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Evolving Skies!

Over 200 cards

18 powerful Pokémon V and 15 enormous Pokémon VMAX

Dragon-type Pokémon return with a new look

More new Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards

24 Trainer cards and a new Special Energy card

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: One-page Che Guevara: el fracaso boliviano 1967
boardgame.description:
Area-movement print-n-play game, ostensibly for 2 players (but probably best solitaire) set during Che Guevara's 1967 insurgency in Bolivia. To win, the guerillas must eliminate the 8 Bolivian army divisions within eight one-month turns, while the Bolivian government must eliminate the Che guerilla unit. Bolivian army divisions cannot leave their regions, but from turn 5, the Bolivians gain one mobile Ranger unit per turn. A variety of optional rules provide much variety to play.
The game consists of an A4 board, 31 counters and one double-sided A4 sheets of rules, optional rules and historical background.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Miód
boardgame.description:
A short and simple family game in which players compete to be first to create honey in their apiaries. The winner is the person who will gain more points from the honey and nectar tokens at the end of the game.

Linden, heather or multi flower? What is your favorite honey? You will win if your bees will result the most hardworking and produce more honey.

The set up is very fast and simple: each player receives 2 beehive cards which should be put in the player’s area and 3 starting bees cards which should be put on the left from the beehives.
The game is played in rounds which are divided into the phases. Firstly, each player receives 3 cards which should be assigned to the following actions: putting nectar tokens into the meadow card; collecting nectar tokens from the meadow and moving the nectar tokens into the bees cards which are next to the beehive. The player who will be the first in filling 2 beehives with nectar tokens is the winner.

boardgame.name: Tales of Vespershard
boardgame.description:
Tales of Vespershard (ToV) is a miniatures skirmish game (32mm) with a fantasy aesthetic. It is based on the Uud universe, created by the Eldritch Foundry. The Vespersdhard represents the ability players have to shape their own universe.
We provide the story and a basic background. The players can use that to come up with any new adventure, story, and campaign, changing and adapting it totheir ideafor a fast and fun miniatures game.

You want an elven-forged empire which has subdued all other races? Or do you want dragons easily upholding the plains? Or maybe for nightmares to come true at night and hunt down the unwary? Well, you can make all this a reality in ToV.

Many things are customizable at the rules level (scenery, campaigns, enemies ...), but you can also customize the miniatures for your gang thanks to the powerful Eldritch Foundry app, an indispensable collaborator for our project.

Fight against your friends in dynamic battles between gangs, with a narrative touch and with heroes designed by you. Evolve your gang and link scenarios to create your own narrative campaign.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mahanadi
boardgame.description:
You are working together to save a life-giving river and its ecosystem. For each one of us, It is not just flowing water, but a deep connection to our being. How will we all work together to save it from contamination?

The players are specialists in their own right taking unique roles with the knowledge and the power that they bring in to save the situation and find a solution. A separate deck of cards for the abilities and contamination levels and land and river tiles for the various zones make up the components of the game.

Players use cards and place tiles to move around the board. The game ends when the last contaminated zone tile has been removed.

Players must together plan their strategy to mesh with their expert's strengths in order to prevent contamination. For example, the Tribe head can identify and find cures for ecosystem contamination, and the bio-Scientist needs only four cards of particular contamination to cure it instead of the normal five—but the contamination is spreading rapidly and time is running out.

If contamination spreads beyond recovery or if too much time elapses, the players all lose. If they stop and regenerate the ecosystem, they all win!

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter Spirits 2: Triple Soul
boardgame.description: Card / Casino Game

boardgame.name: Arena Brutalis
boardgame.description:
Arena Brutalis is a miniature wargame where players battle in a arena with futuristic war machines and weapons. Players can customize their team, select and swap unique weapons and equipment in game, pose their minis, and fight for glory! Miniatures are 3d printed at home and designed to have articulation with customization capability. This unique system was engineered and tested to create the most immersive and robust tabletop game in the world (big claim). It's fun, it's funny, it's ridiculous, it's Arena Brutalis!

First released in 2020, the 2nd edition features updated rules.

go to www.arenabrutalis.com to find out more!

boardgame.name: MADiSON
boardgame.description: MADiSON is a first person psychological horror game that delivers an immersive and terrifying experience.

boardgame.name: Spine
boardgame.description: Spine is a team-based action game, where the chosen ones decide the future of the dystopian world.

boardgame.name: Dying 1983
boardgame.description: In this first person puzzle game, Dying 1983, you will operate the protagonist t

boardgame.name: Outbreak Island
boardgame.description: Outbreak Island is a survival game with detective elements.

boardgame.name: The Path of Calydra
boardgame.description: The Path of Calydra is a beautiful 3D adventure platformer set in the fantastic world of Calysgore.

boardgame.name: Vagrus - The Riven Realms
boardgame.description: Embark on a perilous journey across a realm forsaken by the gods and devastated by an arcane cataclysm.

boardgame.name: Rhythm of the Universe: IONIA
boardgame.description: Get up close with music-inspired creatures in a lush forest teeming with life.

boardgame.name: Farming Simulator 22
boardgame.description: Agriculture
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Arcadegeddon
boardgame.description: As you continue to play you can take on additional challenges from the local “gangs” that hang out in Gilly's Arcade. These will earn you much more than street cred.

boardgame.name: Giants Uprising
boardgame.description: a medieval fantasy action adventure game full of Giants and unlimited destruction!

boardgame.name: Dark Deity
boardgame.description: Command legendary heroes to reshape a land fractured by broken oaths, reckless wars, and secret arcane powers

boardgame.name: SciGirl: The Internship
boardgame.description: 2D action-adventure platformer game about a Science Girl, who goes by the name Sonia, who started an internship in a laboratory where she and her professor are working on stabilizing a chemical that was invented by the professor with which you can shrink or enlarge objects and living matter

boardgame.name: Arcanum: High Magic for Ironsworn
boardgame.description:
From DriveThruRPG:

Embrace the Power of Magic

Arcanum brings a flexible casting system to Ironsworn, predicated on the notion that spellcasting should be more than a collection of individual, predetermined effects. True power is in the Mage's ability to shape reality as desired, through sheer force of intellect and willpower. This supplement gives you a narratively-focused method for implementing magic in your Ironlands. The basic list of contents goes:

The Ways of Magic
Assets for Magic and Magi
Chaos Track Mechanics
New Moves
Ways of Playing a Mage
The Arcanum Character Sheet

Not an Official Ironsworn Product

This is NOT an official Ironsworn product. This is a fan-made supplement that is only possible through the generous licensing granted by Ironsworn author, Shawn Tomkin. Thank you, Shawn!

This work is based on Ironsworn (found at www.ironswornrpg.com), created by Shawn Tomkin, and licensed for our use under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

boardgame.name: Sands of Aura
boardgame.description: Sands of Aura is an open-world action adventure with a fantasy setting of a realm in its twilight--a world buried beneath a sea of sand. Sail across the sandseas to return life to a dying world in an unforgettable experience that is equal parts engaging story and unrelenting, souls-like combat.

boardgame.name: Colostle 2-Player Co-operative Rules
boardgame.description:
From the developer:

This module adds some unique mechanics for 2-player play, and also adds some new tables that you could easily use on your single player adventures as well!

So if you have been enjoying your solo adventure up until now, but would like to try out these rules, why not rope in a friend, and have your character's adventures continue with a buddy!

boardgame.name: The Haruspex of Anzû-Uz
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Mörk Borg Encounter for the A Miserable Dungeon Jam: A Dungeon Most Fowl!

...do you enjoy foie gras? Maybe you'll think twice the next time someone offers you liver. In this vile, Babylonian-inspired, one-page encounter, players will encounter a cult who practice haruspicy upon fattened victims. By studying their still-warm livers, the foul priest Bārû writes his prophecies into the Book of Bārûtu. With the heretical tome almost complete, he intends to use its powers to shatter the lies of The TWO-HEADED BASILISK and pronounce the final truths of the end days.

Will your players destroy him and burn his works? Or will they aid him to pierce the falsehoods of The Nameless Scriptures and discover the truth? Find out with this evocative and easy-to-easy encounter; it can be played on its own, inserted into your ongoing game, or combined with other jam content for a truly fowl experience.

boardgame.name: Necrocarta
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Necrocarta is a solo Carta game where you play as an adventurer, explore a mysterious dungeon on a quest to find the Heart of the Crypt.

It was inspired by Crypt of the Necrodancer and created for gamejamdor4!

To play, you will need:

One standard deck of playing cards, jokers removed
Two six-sided dice
A character marker, like a figurine or a coin
Some way to keep track of your health and inventory, like a piece of paper and a pencil, or a notes app on your phone.

boardgame.name: Unicorn Stew: Trolling the King promo card
boardgame.description:
Order Card:
Play when doubles of any dish are played. Discard one of the doubles.

Card included in GTM Magazine #259

Like New. Card will be in a sleeve. From a smoke-free home.
For Canadian residents, I'll accept Interac e-transfers to save on fees. For US and International residents, I'll accept PayPal.
Buyer pays shipping. I'll get a quote with shipping costs and options. If you would like more images, let me know and I'll send them to you.
Purchases shipped between countries are generally subject to customs fees (e.g. taxes, duties, processing, or brokerage fees). These fees are neither calculated nor collected by me and are not included in the shipping cost or price of the product.
Buyers will not be reimbursed for shipping costs on orders returned due to refusal to pay customs fees. If you have questions, please contact your local customs agency or postal carrier before placing your order.

Comes from a non-smoking home. __________________________________________________
Thank you for considering my promo!
Buyers are responsible for shipping; all shipping is done from 38821.
All payment will be done through Paypal using Friends and Family. Also, because of the post office losing an increased number of packages, I will no longer ship without tracking. For international buyers, this means you will have to pay for customs which will provide a tracking number but will NOT provide insurance.
For US buyers, most promo cards will ship for $4 to the continental US. This will include a tracking number, but not insurance. Insurance will add an additional $5-$6 dollars. For International buyers, most promo cards will ship for between$15-$20. This will include a tracking number, but not insurance. Insurance will add between $20-$40. Note there are some countries that will currently cost more so an exact quote can be provided upon request.
For US buyers, most board games will ship for between $8-$15. This will include a tracking number and insurance. Extremely large packages may cost more. For International buyers, most board games will cost $50 or MORE to ship internationally. This will include a tracking number and insurance. Shipping board games internationally is not recommended.
If you have any questions, feel free to message me.
Thank you once again and have a great day!

boardgame.name: A Pestilence of Maths
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A plague of madness spreads across the countryside: people hopelessly repeating strings of numbers and words until their head bursts into flames and they die in shrieking violence. Trek through unhallowed woods, explore the burned ruins of villages and climb a cursed tower full of deadly encounters as you stave off Madness itself -- or succumb to its fiery embrace.

A Pestilence of Maths is a complete MÖRK BORG adventure created by Ken Lowery for the FÖLK-LORE game jam, featuring a Medieval Gothic spin on Numbers Stations. It is a complete adventure and, likely, a TPK. Best of luck with that.

Includes a 7-page PDF with tables and original adversaries.

boardgame.name: The Living Flame
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Fire that comes from the West is as capricious as any bandit: animate, intelligent, possessed of an obscure sense of humor. Some incinerated by it see their skin, organs and bones fall away – all except for the skull, which remains hovering, wreathed in ever-burning emerald fire. These abominable ignis fatuus crave companionship, and may almost be worth the trouble.

"The Living Flame" is a new party companion made for THE END IS NEAR: THE 24 HOUR MÖRK BORG MISERY JAM.

boardgame.name: Ringwood's Guide to Saints of the Third Age
boardgame.description:
From the description:

“Weary Traveler, you do not have to walk the huddled villages, towering cities and lonesome forests of the Third Age alone. Cast off the chains of the Patrons you know -- the old heretical gods, the mercurial Fey, the Nameless things that lurk in the Outer Dark – and pledge thine service and soul to one of the Consortium of venerated Saints who represent the link between the Mortal and the Divine.

The notorious and scholarly monk Brother Ringwood has compiled herein a list of Saintly aspects, Fools of Office, and Divine Gifts as reward for Service. Merely roll your instruments of chance (perhaps themselves a sign of Office?) to divine your Saintly Patron.

And may the Boons be worth the Price.”

Ringwood’s Guide to Saints of the Third Age is a Medieval Gothic Fantasy spin on traditional warlock patrons, focusing on the peculiar lore that pops up around saintly figures – and the strangle middle ground they occupy between old cultures and modern assimilation, between the mortal and the divine.

With a few simple dice rolls, this dice table can help you generate a unique Saint for your character to aspire to, receive rewards from, or simply fear. Hundreds of potential combinations await -- so take your chances and see what dark Saint lays claim to your soul.

Includes one 1-page PDF with dice table.

boardgame.name: Ringwood's Guide to Forgotten Places of the Third Age
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"Brother Ringwood sends another dispatch from his Travels across this great Continent, and this Manuscript promises to be most Illuminating.

"There are so many places people have been but are no more, Weary Traveler. Too numerous to count, too Hidden to explore, too Forbidding to inventory -- until now. Herein you will find descriptions, aspects, and gathered Lore about these Forgotten Places that hint at what fates befell them -- and perhaps how deserved those Fates were.

"Roll the Dice and fill your Pack, Traveler. Brother Ringwood merely lights the Way; it is you who must make sense of what he has found."

Ringwood's Guide to the Forgotten Places of the Third Age is a Medieval Gothic Fantasy dice table for generating forsaken villages and ghost towns... and dark hints at what made them that way.

Pick up your dice and fill in the blanks, and you'll generate one of hundreds of potential forgotten places ranging from the blasphemous to the pious, and from the righteously punished to the tragic. What you find there and whether it saves or condemns you is up to your party.

Includes one 1-page PDF with dice table.

boardgame.name: Ringwood's Guide to Curses and Cures of the Third Age
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"At great risk to his immortal Soul, Brother Ringwood has plumbed the Depths of common Hedge Magic to uncover that most Degenerate of wyrd wielding: Curses. Such is their Belligerent Potency that even the Lowliest commoner may humble great Kings and wizened Sorcerers -- provided there is enough Hate in their hearts to fuel it.

"The good Brother has documented here one of the most Common (and Powerful) Curse formulations, including dozens of Variations. Careful you do not Speak the words aloud as you read, Weary Traveler; you would not be the first to Curse Oneself!

"But fear not. Just as he reports on the Spiritual Ailments of the Age, so too does Brother Ringwood bring Benedictions to alleviate them. Certain deeds, Pledges and Offerings detailed here may reverse a Curse -- always at a Cost.

"You know well that nothing is free, Weary Traveler. Salvation least of all."

Ringwood's Guide to Curses and Cures of the Third Age is a Medieval Gothic Fantasy dice table for generating curses that may bring your characters low... and the path they may take to free themselves of the burden once more.

Roll the bones and chance fates ranging from the melancholy to the grotesque as your body and mind are assaulted by the venomous will of another. Then find out how you may relieve the curse... and decide if you have the will to follow through.

For further details on the Saints to Pledge to or Defy, read Ringwood's Guide to Saints of the Third Age.

And to learn more about where such offerings may be made, read Ringwood's Guide to Forgotten Places of the Third Age.

Includes one 1-page PDF with dice table.

boardgame.name: White Washers
boardgame.description:
A fun money laundering card game of deception and deduction for 3-5 degenerates.

A group of people get their hands on a fair amount of dirty money. To be able to use it, they decide to launder it together through 5 businesses. The best idea turns messy when each one secretly decides to dupe the other and keep the load of it for themselves. Who will outwit whom and walk away with a cartload of clean money? Play to find out. Play the others to win.

On their turn a player offers a card from their hand to another player and tells them limited information about the card. The other player then decides whether to accept or decline. Some cards are bad and others are good. If the player accepts they will then add the card to their face-up cards for end game scoring. Of they decline, the player who offered the card will place it in their face-up area.

The player who gains the most points from their cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Strike-Out in Skrållahie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Four -Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

As the village Skrållahie is about to have kick-off in their much-anticipated street goat-ball cup, the team captain of one of the children's teams is reported dead.

While the adults shrug it off as a self-decided sacrifice to Auril, the team with the dead player tells a different tale.

Will you take these children's stories seriously?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Wox Darkblade - The Great Old One Warlock
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Meet Wox Darkblade, a Changeling The Great Old One Warlock for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

Here you will find pregenerated character sheets that take this PC from levels 1 through 20.

All equipment was priced using the AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Magic Arms and Armor Price Guide and AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Wondrous Magic Item Price Guides.

boardgame.name: Nalista Soulreaver - The Hexblade Warlock
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Meet Nalista Soulreaver, a Zariel Tiefling The Hexblade Warlock for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

Here you will find pregenerated character sheets that take this PC from levels 1 through 20.

All equipment was priced using the AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Magic Arms and Armor Price Guide and AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Wondrous Magic Item Price Guides.

boardgame.name: A Family Affair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The nephew of a once famous adventurer decides to make a name for himself and bites off more than he can chew. Expecting to scare off a few goblins, the lad quickly finds himself in way over his head. Short on options, and worried for his nephew’s life, he needs your help.

Travel to the ruins of Dhonin's Lookout atop Standiac Hill to find and rescue the young adventurer.

Uncover a plot that could lead to the destruction of the village of Millvein, and even more dire future consequences.

A 3-4 hour adventure for a party of 4-5 first level characters.

boardgame.name: The Spider's Den
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Save the village of Millvein!

Prevent a war with the drow!

In this 3-4 hour adventure for 4-5 characters of 2nd level, travel to a chitine lair to prevent them from destroying the small village of Millvein and inciting a war between the surface and the drow.

boardgame.name: They Call It a Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chase a choldrith trying to incite a war!

Detour through an abandoned dwarven mine when your path is blocked by a cave in!

Fight through dangerous beasts to get back on the choldrith's tail.

In this 6-8 hour adventure for 4-5 characters of 3rd level, explore an old dwarven mine and fight through a hive of dangerous beasts to get back on the trail of the choldrith your group has been pursing.

boardgame.name: The Shadowed Hollows - A Gazetteer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Gazetteer contains


Descriptions of the factions that live in The Shadowed Hollows, a massive cave complex far below the surface



The underground city of Naakrasad and the important NPCs that live there



Three quests leading to brief adventures within the Hollows for characters of level 4 to 6



7 custom maps of the Shadowed Hollows, Naakrasad, and the quest destinations



All necessary monster stat blocks



Everything needed to set the scene for the upcoming second chapter of the Into the Underdark Adventure Series

boardgame.name: Nebula Rush
boardgame.description:
Nebula Rush is a game of exploration on continuously changing game maps for 2 to 4 players. Sail your Pirate Guild’s ships through The Whirly Swirly Neb, gathering resources, avoiding storms and gales, and collecting clues and rumors as to the location of “The Kracken’s” hidden treasure. A game that is Half Sleuth game, Half Exploration, and Half Combat, Nebula Rush keeps you on the edge of your seat as you race to search, locate and claim "The Kracken's" treasure.

On each turn, players either draw a Ship Appearance Card (which can put the ship and any player's game board) or keep their ship out of play. The you fight, draw treasure and rumors, buy items for your ships and discard resource cards if necessary.

All players start with 3 Ships in their Guild totaling a Manifest value of 13. If the Player has more Befallen Cards + SRS Resource Cards in their hand than their Guild's Manifest value, they discard to the Manifest value.

When a Player has a completed one of the multiple Treasure Maps AND has one of their Ships in the System Hex of the completed Treasure Map, they claim "The Kraken's" Treasure and become Master of The Neb.

The primary means for the player to win is to claim "The Kraken's" Treasure. Other ways to win are to eliminate all other Player Ships, or to have all 6 Legendary Captains (a type of Befallen Card) on each of their Ships.

boardgame.name: The Hill of Rags and Bones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battle against a Deadly Hill Giant to save the Greenfields!

Combat the Hill Giant Gorge and save those trapped in his path in this tier one adventure - THE HILL OF RAGS AND BONES!

Starting with the desperate rescue of an innocent farming family from a burning house, before moving through swamp and caverns to a final deadly confrontation, THE HILL OF RAGS AND BONES is a challenge Tier one adventure for Player characters at level two to four.

Resolve a Bullywug civil war and prevent the summoning of a Kou-Tao god's avatar, all while gathering the resources and weapons you need to bring down Gorge the Hill Giant. Fully compatible with Storm King's Thunder as well as working perfectly as a stand-alone adventure, this 30 page full colour book features four different adventure locations, each designed to bring a deadly challenge to a tier one party of adventurers.

Armed with unique weapons and potions designed to combat Gorge, this adventure climaxes in a deadly battle against the might of the Hill Giant at his would-be shrine. Battle the Hill Giant with traps and trickery, using your wits and your strength to make it through. Only the bravest and boldest of adventurers will survive!

boardgame.name: The Blizzard of Axe and Sword
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

BATTLE FROST GIANTS ACROSS THE FROZEN NORTH OF FAERUN!

Starting with the battle to save the village of Lamastop and ending a Frost Giant's ice palace, the BLIZZARD OF AXE AND SWORD takes tier two player characters on an epic adventure across the snowy north. Fight through blizzards, atop frozen lakes and glaciers, and take on the might of a Frost Giant Jarl and his clan in battle!

Fully compatible with Storm King's Thunder, The Whitefaire Adventurer's Guide, or the forthcoming Rime of the Frost Maiden, this 57 page full colour book features seven different campaign environments, each packed with encounters to challenge your players. The choice of route is up to the players, whether to go underground or atop the mountain pass, or beneath the mountains into a dark dungeon.

This book also includes a wide range of NPC's to work alongside. You and your players can lead a Deep Gnome revolution against their Duergar oppressers, or fight alongside a ice-mermaid clan atop a glacier lake!

Featuring unique magical items such as the Ghost Blade or the fabled Hammer of Harandar, the adventure book is packed full of creative challenges and battles to test the character's will, bravery and strength in the face of overwhelming odds.

Will you be strong enough to defeat Jarl Torrfin and his giants, or will the terrible violence of his blizzard overwhelm you?

boardgame.name: The Kings of Fire and Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

FIGHT TO SAVE ORINZ FROM THE WAR OF THE FIRE GIANTS!

Resolve the war of battling Fire Giants and face off against Queen Uterslav or Tyrant Flekstag in the epic Tier 3 adventure, THE KINGS OF FIRE AND FORGE.

This book is the next adventure in the series started with the best-selling Dark Peaks adventure, THE BLIZZARD OF AXE AND SWORD. Beginning with the rescue of the merchant Celne from between the lines of warring giants, and ending in an epic confrontation with a Fire Giant Lord and their allies, THE KINGS OF FIRE AND FORGE takes the adventurers upon an epic journey through the Giant's Reach mountains. At it's heart is the question: is it better to have a single tyrant bringing order or the endless choatic risks that freedom brings?

Fully compatible with Storm King's Thunder as well as working perfectly as a stand-alone adventure, this 59 page full colour book features six different adventure locations, each designed to bring a deadly challenge to a tier 3 party of adventurers. The resolution of this adventure is up to them - will they choose a single leader to hold this area, or fight to free the people from both of these would-be overlords? Will they negotiate a peaceful resolution or will this adventure end in literally gigantic violence!?

This book also includes a wide range of NPC's to work alongside. From Queen Uterslav and her Formorian minions, to the master of the Town of Orinz and his fiery, griffon-riding wife, each NPC will give your players a memorable character to work with and call upon when the moment requires.

Including rules for many different unique magical weapons - including those crafted by the hands of the Fire Giants themselves - this adventure will challenge both might and morals in the decisions the adventurers will face. Who will the player characters stand with? And what will that decision cost them?

The choice of paths to find out is up to you!

boardgame.name: Storybook Brawl
boardgame.description:
Storybook Brawl is a card based auto-battler with fairy tale and fantasy themes. Good vs. Evil compete as you recruit fairytale characters to fight for your team.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Mansion of the Minimizing Mage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Honey, I shrunk the party! In this adventure for four to five 3rd level characters, a dastardly wizard shrinks a group of brave heroes to mere inches tall. They must navigate the evil mage's dilapidated mansion trying to find a way to reverse his baleful magic. All the while, the party must contend with the rats, homunculi, and various mutants prowling the corridors. Sometimes life’s smallest problems are the most deadly.

boardgame.name: The Hoard of Salmadin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Not much happens in the mining town of Oreton until now. During a recent dig, a young miner came across an old and fairly decrepit leather backpack. This would be unremarkable but for one thing: the name of Salmadin was richly embroidered onto it.

Salmadin was a warlord that carved a territory for himself around 500 years ago, a territory that now includes the lands in and around Oreton. Salmadin’s success brought him much wealth, which also attracted him enemies. It is not known exactly how Salmadin came to his end, but stories abound about his fascination with immortality, so some believe he rests in the mountains, waiting for the right moment to return and take back his land. Whatever the truth, Salmadin’s hoard was never found, and neither was his final resting place. The finding of the backpack has stirred up renewed interest in the legend and attracted aspiring adventurers to the mines of Oreton.

However, these adventurers have not returned from their explorations, and the call has gone out for more brave souls to determine what is going on before the town’s copper trade is affected by rumours of haunted mines.

Will you be the ones to uncover the truth about what happened to Salmadin and find his missing hoard?

boardgame.name: Danger at Twincross Gully (Solo)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dare to face the dangers of Twincross Gully in this original adventure!

Choose your own difficulty level. Normal encounters are scaled for three to four players. You can also choose to scale up your encounters to Heroic if you would like additional challenges (and rewards!), or if you are playing with five to six players.

boardgame.name: The King's Hunt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A king bears a horrible curse that torments all of his lands and subjects. The people cry out for salvation from the ravenous wolves that stalk the towns and countryside, wolves the king has forbidden anyone from harming under penalty of death. Can you unravel the mystery surrounding the cursed lands of Blackheart and their tormented king or be trapped there forever?

Explore the lands of Blackheart, a once prosperous and peaceful realm that is now stalked by a demonic wolf and its vile offspring. Unravel the mysteries surrounding the Wolf Guard and why they prevent anyone but the cursed king from hunting the murderous wolves under penalty of death.

boardgame.name: Vault of Dusk
boardgame.description:
A Planar Adventure for 10th-level Characters Featuring the Feywild!

Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Vault of Dusk, an adventure in the Tales of the Infinite Planes series highlighting the different parts of the multiverse! In this scenario, drow elves are honing in on the legendary Vault of Dusk in the Feywild city of Cendriane, but the characters have a chance to beat them to the prize if they move quickly and trust the word of a drow noble. What really waits in the City of Fallen Stars, and how trustworthy is the word of a drow? The adventure is designed for a party of 10th-level characters but can easily be adjusted for higher- or lower-level parties.

A copy of Codex of the Infinite Planes is suggested to help add background to the plane and its inhabitants, but it is not required to run the adventure. In addition, one of the hooks for the adventure involves the World Serpent Inn, a sprawling tavern occupying its own plane of existence. More details can be found in Infinite Doors of the World Serpent, including using the World Serpent Inn as a group patron. Both of these products can be found on the DMsGuild.

Monster statistics from sources outside the Monster Manual are marked with an asterisk (*) and reprinted in the adventure Appendix.

boardgame.name: Queen's Hoard Expanded
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Queen's Hoard Expanded is a supplement that provides a series of encounters and events that will enrich the experience of your players when playing Hoard of the Dragon Queen.

boardgame.name: Star Adventurer's Background Assistant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you’re working up some characters for that space opera style star romp and you start to run out of ideas. Sure, this one is a good gunner, and that one can patch the others up after a fight… but what about their background? What’s their story? What makes them tick?

This handy assistant product helps solve that. The Star Adventurer’s Background Assistant is a random roller and inspiration guide rolled into one. You start by rolling on three different chart columns: Origins, Major Event, and then Random Issue. Then you read up the details on each and make any additional random rolls/choices if called for. Each descriptor encourages you to think about a certain element and work it into the character’s story.

boardgame.name: 100 Critters for Alien Biomes 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product offers a collection of 100 critters to populate your alien biomes with. Some creatures may be worthy of giving additional game stats while others are small, defenseless, and make for good background details or other game effects (chewing wires, producing toxic spray, etc.). Included in each entry is the critter’s name, general creature type (rodent, nocturnal lizard, etc.), and an additional descriptive (communication, use in galactic trade, etc.)

boardgame.name: 50 Most Curious Books 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different books to fill the shelves of a fantasy campaign library. Some hint at magical research value while others cover a variety of other topics. Included in each entry is the following: Title of book, author, page count, binding type, condition that the book is in when found, and the overall market value of the book (in current condition) listed in gold coins.

boardgame.name: Courthouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Fortress in the Sand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 560th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a large fortification, seemingly created from natural rock formations, in a desert.

The map is 56 x 60 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 48 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Bone Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 561st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a makeshift bridge of bone crossing a gorge in a dead forest.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.
