boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 562nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a canyon and some wooden bridges leading across it.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Playstation 5 Dualsense Wireless Controller
boardgame.description:
The DualSense wireless controller for PS5 offers immersive haptic feedback, dynamic adaptive triggers and a built-in microphone, all integrated into an iconic design.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Ancient Temple Ruin
boardgame.description:

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: Drainage Ditch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 566th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a drainage ditch in marshland.

boardgame.name: Suburb-ville
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Suburb-ville with its unparalleled nightlife! Mobs take to the streets to take in the sights - dilapidated skyscrapers, abandoned houses, a creaky-creepy, clown-filled mall, and a host of other landmarks to catch your eye.

Or another part of you if you aren't careful.

Suburb-ville is a zombie apocalypse, sandbox world for BaG tabletop role-playing system. It contains tools to make running any zombie-theme campaign as easy and painless as possible.

boardgame.name: .dungeon
dot dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

.dungeon is a book about traveling through a virtual, fantasy world. One person takes on the role of the World, filling in the nooks and crannies with dungeons and adventures that they think up or borrow from books they already own. Everyone else is a Player and creates a Character to explore those nooks, discover their treasure, and interact with NPCs and other flesh-and-blood folks in the virtual world.

The thing that sets .dungeon apart from other books is the inspiration it takes from social games like Werewolf and Munchkin. The real world can (and will) affect the game you create. Each class has different powers based on physical things you do, or different parts of your life. The witch uses their tattoos to cast spells while the wizard uses their favorite book. The knight makes vows while the leader can offer gifts to the other players to aid them. There are 10 classes total to choose from, including the bard, the troll, and the artist.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 24
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

Within this collection are 100 different characters. Each Character has an origin, a reason for leaving, family members and their disposition towards the character. Non-human Characters also have a middle name in common for non native speakers. Each character comes with character points to spend on abilities and the players can decide which profession they want to follow in the Morgalad Core RPG Book, and they have money to buy equipment.

Whether providing a new character after an unfortunate death or providing a new character for a new player this book provides random characters from level 1-5.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El gran libro de los personajes

boardgame.name: Shade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Serans
boardgame.description:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Plague Dragon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: The Author and the Sea
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Author and The Sea is a mystery for Vaesen - Nordic Horror Roleplaying Game that takes place in a quiet little fishing village in Western Denmark. An author has gone missing, and as the Society begins its exploration they are slowly drawn into a deeper and more dangerous mystery and soon their own lifes may be at stake as they confront a Vaesen never encountered before.

The mystery plays out near the lighthouse Hanstholm - An Alternative Base in Jutland, though it can easily be played with Castle Gyllencreutz or Ravnholm Estate.

The mystery draws upon the folklore of the Strandvarsler but also another Vaesen, which is introduced here for the first time. The mystery can be played in one or two sessions, and it is suited to be played with either just one player, one group or a combination of one player and one group.

The Author and The Sea introduces a new Contact, a mysterious tome, and a new Vaesen. The mystery is the second part of the Hanstholm trilogy. The first part is The King and The Lighthouse.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The Author and the Sea PDF

boardgame.name: The King and The Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The King and The Lighthouse is a mystery for Vaesen taking place in the outmost parts of Jutland confronting The Society with an ancient Vaesen and ruler of the land. The events take place at Hanstholm Lighthouse on three fateful nights that may change the Denmark forever.

The mystery is a tie-in with Hanstholm - An Alternative Base introducing the players to the location and given them the option of acquiring a new headquarters if only temporarily.

The mystery draws upon the folklore of the Strandvarsler. The mystery can be played in one or two sessions.

Included are two new Upgrades for Headquarters, a mysterious tome, magical items and tantalizing hints of The Society's little known past.

The King and The Lighthouse is the first part of the Hanstholm trilogy. The Second part is The Author and The Sea.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The King and The Lighthouse PDF

boardgame.name: The Fence Ghasts from Linnamannsland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Fence Ghasts from Linnamannsland - A Vaesen Mystery is an adventure exploring the border between the old and new in a small Swedish village, as a terrible monster haunts the construction site of a railroad, and the villagers are powerless to undo the misdeeds of the past.

The adventure tales a deep dive in Scandinavian folklore and traditions to create a strange and challenging tale for the investigators. The mystery is based around a new type of Vaesen. You can learn more about the Skelflytter here.

The adventure can be played in 1-2 sessions.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The Fence Ghasts from Linnamannsland PDF

boardgame.name: Hanstholm Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hanstholm Lighthouse is an alternate base for Vaesen - Nordic Horror Roleplaying introducing a new headquarters for The Society to use as an alternate or a temporary base of operations.

The lighthouse lies in Jutland, Denmark, far from major cities in an old land, that once was ruled by powerful beings whose presence is still felt. Who raised the lighttower and to what purpose is a mystery, but they did pass it on to The Society.

Hanstholm Lighthouse can function both as a new headquarter or as a temporary one. There are rules and tips on how to use the base, and with the supplement follows new Upgrades, Personnel and Contacts. For the gamemaster is a set of Threats to inspire new trouble.

boardgame.name: Terrangarths Time Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Drop your players into Terrangarth's Time Tomb. A rouge like, Groundhog Day style adventure in which the players must solve puzzles and escape the dungeon. Expect a lot of death and many resurrections!

Kid friendly. Takes about an hour to run.

boardgame.name: To Appease Hunger
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Times are tough for the fishing industry of Dougan's Hole. You have been hired by a fisher named Karita to help her stay afloat during the "Endless Winter" of the Cold Goddess, Auril. Your charitable fortune may catch a lead to another's hardship in the end.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 2.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Codmothers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

A group known as the Codmothers has been causing problems in Targos. Can you help two young gnomes expose them before they give you an offer you cannot refuse?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Oh Brother Where Art Thou?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DC-POA-Z-T1S3 Oh Brother Where Art Thou?

There’s Something Fishy Going On

Record hauls of Knucklehead Trout near Termalaine is a cause for celebration, or is it?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This adventure uses the ‘In Too Deep’ DungeonCraft Story Seed.

This adventure begins after a night of festivities. The large number trout sitting in the bay attracts a powerful, ravenous creature and presents a mystery to be solved.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Jupiter Hell
boardgame.description:
Jupiter Hell is a roguelike set in a 90's flavored sci-fi universe. Set on the moons of Jupiter, the game pits a lone space marine against overwhelming demonic forces. Rip and tear zombies, demons and unmentionable monstrosities, using classic weaponry such as shotguns, chainguns, railguns and the trusty chainsaw. All to the shine of CRT monitors and the tune of heavy metal!

Dive deep into a true form of the 30 year old roguelike game genre that has resurged in popularity. Experience turn-based, grid-based permadeath and fully procedural levels, all in glorious 3D visuals. Get ready for the spiritual successor to DoomRL, the parody roguelike that years ago streamlined the traditional format and popularised a new wave of accessible roguelikes. Distilled, hardcore gameplay, fast-paced challenge and limitless death all await.

Welcome to Jupiter Hell.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Skåne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description: Skåne is the southernmost part of Sweden. Game rules are the same as Ticket to Ride Europe.

boardgame.name: Duck Duck Dead Duck
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A submission to the Miserable Dungeon Jam: A Dungeon Most Fowl. Includes a room, item, and monster to play a game with. Potentially a little silly, and fully compatible with Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: From Duks till Dawn
boardgame.description: A scenario for Mörk Borg created for the A Miserable Dungeon Jam.

boardgame.name: Village Pillage: À L'Abordage
boardgame.description:
Village Pillage - A L'Abordage is a stand alone game with new villagers, but also pirates to help you become the king!

To become the king, you will have to acquire 4 relics.
In this lawless world, everything is paid for in turnips, including the precious relics that are essential to your royal victory. With the same villagers as the other players, you will have to make the difference and play skillfully against your table neighbours. During the game, you can recruit new villagers for more powerful effects. Add pirates to the game to enjoy even more powerful effects... and risky ones!

boardgame.name: Jungle speed + Jungle speed électronique
boardgame.description:
In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes. It requires a steady hand -- which can be hard to maintain during the many fits of maniacal laughter! The wooden Totem sits in the middle of the table, waiting for the player with the fastest reflexes to snatch it up and win the game.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. In order to win you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Each turn, all of the players reveal one of their cards. If two cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the Totem. The faster player then gives their cards to their unfortunate adversary.

To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the Totem by mistake -- a grave error. Other cards force all players to make a grab at once, change the method of play, or otherwise add to the difficulty.

Jungle Speed Electronique keeps the familiar game play elements from Jungle Speed: Players reveal cards from their individual stacks one at a time, and whenever two players have identical cards face-up in front of themselves, they race to grab the totem first. Whoever does so gives his cards to the slowpoke. The first player to rid himself of cards wins.

What's new in the electronic version of this game is the totem will give you directions from time to time that change the nature of game play – some of which might lead you into doing the wrong thing! Jungle Speed Electronique includes three levels of game play with a dozen special actions programmed into the totem.

boardgame.name: Sushi Mania
boardgame.description:
Sushi Mania is a real-time, simultaneous, competitive game. Each player represents a Sushiman trying to deliver their orders, the best they can, accordingly to the sushis still available.

Players must simultaneously draw cards from the deck, each card representing an order. The orders show the sushis to be taken from the global repository, temper them with Shoyu or Wasabi when needed. Once complete, they draw a new order. The game ends when there's no new order, or no available sushi. The player who fulfilled more orders is the big winner.

Be fast and use strategy to achieve the best combination before others do!

boardgame.name: How Dost Thou Like Them Eggs
boardgame.description: An empty, trapped room for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Unserjass
boardgame.description: UnserJass (OurJass) is a 2 player Jass game that brings together elements of Bela, Handjass, Jo-jotte, as well as some new ideas. The goal of the game is to score game points (1-2 per hand) by bidding for the trump suit and then successfully carrying out your bid during the hand.

boardgame.name: Postcard Tobruk
boardgame.description:
A very fast and simple (but subtle) minimalist rendition of the 5 (possible) major battles around Tobruk during World War 2, Jan 41-Nov 42.
Basically brigade to division to (Italian) corps level.
Indeterminant time periods but 4-7 turns.
Unique rules regarding armored/panzer vs. (Disrupted) infantry units, and Rommel (with a desert/fennec fox) is on the scene to chase the desert rats.
Pressed Attack/Desperate Defense combat options.

Anyone - including schools and libraries - is free to print this off in A6/4"x6" or A5/5"x8" format in as many copies as you like and send them to family and friends who might be interested ... as long as you keep my copyright statement, its Dedication, and my history quotes. All other publication rights, including/especially for large, conventional boxed format are reserved to me for licensing.

It is advisable to photocopy/enlarge the front to A4/11"x17" for an optimal piece size and to A3/11"x17" for optimal map size. You can enlarge the rules as much as you need to.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Slugfest
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An slimy intersection room to fit in your dungeon - recommended for ducks and duck lovers.

boardgame.name: Deutsches Volkstrachtenspiel
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 60 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Supplement edition was printed in a magazine - most likely "Onkel Antons Kinderkalender" - had the same board design and came with cut out meeples.
